Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2010 02:00AM - edited Jan 13, 2010 02:02AM by finola I cannot make that choice for you but am testing right now have family history of bc have had friends with breast cancer in the past and going thru treatment right now.Â  I was telling my surgeon that they are just breasts fatty tissue and if I kept mine I would alway worry about every lump and bump had bx on both of them now having to do it again and for me I would be less stressed with both of them gone I can buy new perky breasts but cannot buy my life back I have three small children so it was a no brainer for me there will not be much breast left on one side after surgery again for the calfications lot of them. wishing you speedy recovery after your surgery if you go that route. atypical ductal hyperplasia 14 yrs ago (r) negtive on left sterotactial bx (5) yrs ago fin
